        Returns an image that is made of leftImage and rightImage, puts them side by side.
        Parameters:
        leftImage - image to put to the left side
        rightImage - image to put to the rigth side
        Returns:
        an image containing leftImage in its left side and rightImage in its right side

                                                            java.awt.image.BufferedImage image2)
        Puts image2 onto image1 and returns the result
        Parameters:
        image1 - any image
        image2 - any image
        Returns:
        the image that is created when image2 is put onto image1 (in (0,0))

      • getBlurredImage

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage getBlurredImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage imageToBlur,
                                                           int neighborCount,
                                                           double similarity)
        Parameters:
        imageToBlur - any image
        neighborCount - how many neighboring pixels will be accounted for when the effect is being applied, higher values means more blur
        similarity - defines how similar neighboring pixels will look a like, this value should be in range [0,1]
        Returns:
        a blurred image

      • getBlurredImage

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage getBlurredImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage imageToBlur,
                                                           int neighborCount)
        Does getBlurredImage(BufferedImage, int, double) with similarity = 1d
        Parameters:
        imageToBlur - any image
        neighborCount - how many neighboring pixels will be accounted for when the effect is being applied, higher values means more blur
        Returns:
        a blurred image

      • getGrayscaledImage

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage getGrayscaledImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage imageToChange,
                                                              int harshness,
                                                              boolean setColorToDarkAreas)
        Does getGrayscaledImage(BufferedImage, int, boolean, Color) with Color set to either Color.BLACK or Color.WHITE depending one the boolean setColorToDarkAreas.
        Parameters:
        imageToChange - any image
        harshness - an integer in range [0,255] specifying the threshold for secondaryColor
        setColorToDarkAreas - specifies if dark areas or bright areas are going to be painted by secondaryColor according to harshness
        Returns:
        a grayscaled image with dark/bright areas painted with secondaryColor

      • getGrayscaledImage

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage getGrayscaledImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage imageToChange)
        This method is extremely similar to getGrayscaledImage(BufferedImage, int, boolean, Color) and getGrayscaledImage(BufferedImage, int, boolean). The only difference is that this is more of a default (also a different) method for creating grayscaled images because this method doesn't care about harshness and just grayscales the images you give it.
        Parameters:
        imageToChange - any image
        Returns:
        a grayscaled image which is a copy of imageToChange

      • getGrayscaledImage

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage getGrayscaledImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage imageToChange,
                                                              int harshness,
                                                              boolean setColorToDarkAreas,
                                                              java.awt.Color secondaryColor)
        Paints the dark or bright areas with secondaryColor and returns a copy of that image
        Parameters:
        imageToChange - any image
        harshness - an integer in range [0,255] specifying the threshold for secondaryColor
        setColorToDarkAreas - specifies if dark areas or bright areas are going to be painted by secondaryColor according to harshness
        secondaryColor - any color to paint the dark/bright areas
        Returns:
        a grayscaled image with dark/bright areas painted with secondaryColor

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage getInvertedImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage imageToInvert)
